meanings.definition: those who forcibly prevent or hinder something from happening
meanings.sent1: The deforcers at the protest blocked the entrance to the building.
meanings.sent2: The deforcers in the story tried to stop the hero from saving the day.
meanings.sent3: The deforcers at the party kept changing the music, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The deforcers of progress stood in the way of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The deforcers in the movie were portrayed as villains, always causing trouble.

meanings.definition: to forcibly prevent or hinder something from happening
meanings.sent1: She deforcers the meeting by constantly interrupting others.
meanings.sent2: The security guard deforcers any unauthorized access to the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deforcers the peaceful atmosphere by knocking things over.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain deforcers the outdoor event, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules deforcers any flexibility in the schedule, making it hard to adapt.
